headline: Trump Says Tariff Money Could 'Replace The Income Tax' — April Customs Collections Hit Record $15.4 Billion As New Duties Take Effect
summary: President Donald Trump said that revenue from tariffs could potentially eliminate the need for the federal income tax, citing the period from 1870 to 1913 when tariffs were the primary source of federal income and the nation experienced significant prosperity. Record Revenue Meets Real-World Roadblocks That claim to Fox News comes as U.S. customs duties surged to a historic high in April. headline: J.D. Power: Car buyers are still interested in EVs and Tesla alternatives
summary: Despite the whirlwind of headlines about auto tariffs, EV mandates, and even the potential loss of EV tax credits, Americans are still very much interested in EVs. Including those not named Tesla.

raw.headline: J.D. Power: Car buyers are still interested in EVs and Tesla alternatives
raw.summary: Despite the whirlwind of headlines about auto tariffs, EV mandates, and even the potential loss of EV tax credits, Americans are still very much interested in EVs. Including those not named Tesla.

headline: HMC Q4 Earnings Miss, FY26 View Downbeat Amid Tariff Woes
summary: For fiscal 2026, Honda forecasts an operating profit of 500 billion yen, indicating a contraction of 58.8% year over year.

raw.headline: HMC Q4 Earnings Miss, FY26 View Downbeat Amid Tariff Woes
raw.summary: For fiscal 2026, Honda forecasts an operating profit of 500 billion yen, indicating a contraction of 58.8% year over year.

headline: U.S. Auto Stocks General Motors (GM) and Ford (F) Diverge on Capital Efficiency
summary: The two most prominent Detroit-based automakers, Ford Motor (F) and General Motors (GM), are exposed to the same industry trends, yet they’ve experienced notably different stock performances over the past twelve months. Ford suffered chronic losses while GM was basking in bountiful gains. Price comparison showing how divergence between F and GM began in mid-2024 The auto industry is known for its high cyclicality and capital-intensive nature, requiring companies to effectively navigate macroecon
